addition.40:
*

This tests {@code foo.equals(foo)}, {@code foo.equals(null)}, and a few other operations.
addition.42:
*

For more extensive testing, add multiple equality groups. Each group should contain objects
addition.43: * that are equal to each other but unequal to the objects in any other group. For example:
addition.55: *   <li>comparing each object against itself returns true
addition.56: *   <li>comparing each object against null returns false
addition.57: *   <li>comparing each object against an instance of an incompatible class returns false
addition.58: *   <li>comparing each pair of objects within the same equality group returns true
addition.59: *   <li>comparing each pair of objects from different equality groups returns false
addition.60: *   <li>the hash codes of any two equal objects are equal
addition.63:
*

When a test fails, the error message labels the objects involved in the failed comparison as
addition.68: * jth item in the ith equality group, where both equality
addition.69: *       groups and the items within equality groups are numbered starting from 1. When either a
addition.70: *       constructor argument or an equal object is provided, that becomes group 1.
addition.95: * Adds {@code equalityGroup} with objects that are supposed to be equal to each other and not
addition.96: * equal to any other equality groups added to this tester.
